body_text:
Adds the about:studies page. Seems to work. WIP because it still needs tests.
@gijsk When I run the test that I added with this PR (browser_about_studies.js) with this PR I get the following failure:
18 INFO TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | browser/extensions/shield-recipe-client/test/browser/browser_about_studies.js | A promise chain failed to handle a rejection: Component returned failure code: 0xc1f30001 (NS_ERROR_NOT_INITIALIZED) [nsIMessageSender.sendAsyncMessage] - stack: null
Rejection date: Thu Jul 20 2017 14:56:59 GMT-0700 (PDT) - false == true - JS frame :: resource://testing-common/PromiseTestUtils.jsm :: assertNoUncaughtRejections :: line 265
Stack trace:
    resource://testing-common/PromiseTestUtils.jsm:assertNoUncaughtRejections:265
    chrome://mochikit/content/browser-test.js:Tester.prototype.nextTest<:429
    testScope/test_finish/<@chrome://mochikit/content/browser-test.js:1075:11
    run@chrome://mochikit/content/browser-test.js:1012:9

I don't really know how to track this down. Any ideas?

title: about:studies
body:
Adds the about:studies page. Seems to work. WIP because it still needs tests.

@gijsk When I run the test that I added with this PR (`browser_about_studies.js`) with this PR I get the following failure:

```
18 INFO TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | browser/extensions/shield-recipe-client/test/browser/browser_about_studies.js | A promise chain failed to handle a rejection: Component returned failure code: 0xc1f30001 (NS_ERROR_NOT_INITIALIZED) [nsIMessageSender.sendAsyncMessage] - stack: null
Rejection date: Thu Jul 20 2017 14:56:59 GMT-0700 (PDT) - false == true - JS frame :: resource://testing-common/PromiseTestUtils.jsm :: assertNoUncaughtRejections :: line 265
Stack trace:
    resource://testing-common/PromiseTestUtils.jsm:assertNoUncaughtRejections:265
    chrome://mochikit/content/browser-test.js:Tester.prototype.nextTest<:429
    testScope/test_finish/<@chrome://mochikit/content/browser-test.js:1075:11
    run@chrome://mochikit/content/browser-test.js:1012:9
```

I don't really know how to track this down. Any ideas?
